Myrthe Klaver

  • Joined 01 July 2022
  • From the Netherlands 🇳🇱

sex disparity
liver cancer

I was born in the ‘kop van Overijssel’ but moved to Groningen to obtain both my BSc and MSc in Biomedical Sciences at the University of Groningen. During my bachelor's I got captivated by cellular senescence, which brought me to Marco’s group for my first master internship. Here I examined the effect of histone deacetylase inhibitors on the induction of senescence. After graduating, I worked at the Radiotherapy and Molecular Cell Biology department of the UMCG for a year. As of July 2022, I’m happy to join Marco’s lab once again for a PhD project. This time I will work on a project that focuses on liver senescence.

Previous Next
Cellular Senescence ● Aging ● Cancer ● Tissue Repair
